intro: Isotrema cucurbitoides, commonly known as the "bitterleaf vine," is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, green, edible fruits that turn red when mature.
